Question 02) Mastering Light implies both a technological advance and a certain release of the cyclic rhythms of nature, with the passage of stations and the alternations of day and night. With the night lighting, the darkness gives way to clarity, and the temporal perception begins to guide the marking of the clock. If light invades the night, it loses sense of traditional separation between work and rest - all parts of the day can be used productively.
In relation to the world of work, the transformation pointed out in the text was due to the
A) Improvement of the quality of industrial production.
B) Reduction of employment supply in rural areas.
C) permission to the worker to control his own schedules.
D) Decreased effort requirements at work with machines.
E) expansion of the period available for the workday.
